citation.article-title: Phylogeny of species in the family Neisseriaceae isolated from human dental plaque and description of Kingella orale sp. nov.

p.s: Emended description of the genus Kingella

As described in Bergey’s Manual of Systematic Bacteriology (24), with the following modifications. Straight rods 0.6 to 1 μm in diameter by 1 to 3 μm long. Indole and urease negative. Chemoorganotrophic. Acid is produced from glucose and a limited number of other carbohydrates. The G+C content of the DNA is 47 to 58 mol%.
